channel.title: Visual Studio Code on Sujith Quintelier
channel.description: Recent content in Visual Studio Code on Sujith Quintelier

item.title: vscode: January 2026 Insiders (version 1.109)
item.description:
This brief entry announces the Visual Studio Code January 2026 Release (Insiders) version 1.109 and points readers to the full article for details on whatâ€™s new in this release.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: vscode: December 2025 (version 1.108)
item.description:
The December 2025 Visual Studio Code release (version 1.108) introduces a set of updates, improvements, and fixes. The full release notes detail editor and tooling enhancements, performance and accessibility work, and changes relevant to extensions and development workflows.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: github: Auto model selection is generally available in GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio Code
item.description:
GitHub Copilot’s auto model selection is now generally available in Visual Studio Code for all Copilot plans. The ‘auto’ setting lets Copilot automatically pick the most appropriate model for you based on current model and context.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: vscode: November 2025 Insiders (version 1.107)
item.description:
This article summarizes whatâ€™s new in the Visual Studio Code November 2025 Release (Insiders build v1.107) and invites readers to read the full release notes for details.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: dotnet: Microsoft Learn MCP Server Elevates Development
item.description:
Microsoft’s Learn MCP server improves the Copilot developer experience by providing practical examples and clear integration steps for Visual Studio, Visual Studio Code, the Copilot CLI, and the Copilot Coding Agent.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: vscode: Introducing the VS Code Insiders Podcast
item.description:
Announcement of the VS Code Insiders Podcast â€” a new series serving as an insider’s guide to the features, decisions, and people shaping the future of Visual Studio Code.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: azure: [In preview] Generally Available: MSSQL extension integration with GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio Code
item.description:
Microsoft announced general availability of an integration between the MSSQL extension for Visual Studio Code and GitHub Copilot, bringing AI-powered SQL assistance into the VS Code workflow to reduce repetitive tasks, accelerate development, and assist with database schema design.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure SQL updates for November 2025
item.description:
Public preview announced in November 2025: the MSSQL extension for Visual Studio Code adds an interactive Edit Data interface that lets you view, modify, and insert table rows without manually writing T-SQL, improving data editing workflows for Azure SQL.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Index Advisor for Azure DocumentDB
item.description:
Public preview of Index Advisor integrated into the DocumentDB for VS Code extension. It helps you view and debug database performance and uses natural-language recommendations to suggest optimal indexing and best practices for MongoDB workloads.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Online and offline migrations in Azure DocumentDB Migration extension
item.description:
Microsoft released the Azure DocumentDB Migration extension for Visual Studio Code in public preview, enabling zero-cost migrations of MongoDB workloads to Azure DocumentDB with support for both online and offline migration modes.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Oracle to PostgreSQL migration tooling in Visual Studio Code
item.description:
Microsoft announced a public preview of Oracle-to-PostgreSQL migration tooling built into the Azure Database for PostgreSQL extension for Visual Studio Code. The tool aims to make migrating from Oracle to PostgreSQL simpler and faster by providing conversion support directly inside VS Code.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure Cosmos DB for Visual Studio Code
item.description:
Azure announced the general availability of the Azure Cosmos DB extension for Visual Studio Code, a production-ready VS Code extension that lets developers manage Cosmos DB resources and develop against Cosmos DB directly inside the editor.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: PostgreSQL extension for Visual Studio Code with GitHub Copilot
item.description:
Microsoft announces the general availability of the PostgreSQL extension for Visual Studio Code, which enables connecting to PostgreSQL instances, running queries, managing connection profiles, and supports Microsoft Entra ID with integration for GitHub Copilot.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Automated Testing Framework for Logic Apps [Standard]
item.description:
Azure announced general availability of an automated testing framework for Azure Logic Apps (Standard) in the Visual Studio Code extension, enabling developers and integration specialists to create automated tests to improve workflow reliability.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: vscode: Introducing the Visual Studio Code Private Marketplace: Your Team's Secure, Curated Extension Hub ðŸŽ‰
item.description:
Microsoft announced that the Visual Studio Code Private Marketplace is now generally available â€” a secure, curated extension hub for teams to manage and distribute VS Code extensions privately. Read the full article: https://code.visualstudio.com/blogs/2025/11/18/PrivateMarketplace

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: github: Manage Copilot coding agent tasks in Visual Studio Code
item.description:
GitHub announced that you can now track and manage the Copilot coding agent directly within Visual Studio Code using a streamlined, centralized â€œmission controlâ€ view that includes access to session logs and management tools without leaving the editor.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Raptor mini is rolling out in public preview for GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub has begun a public preview rollout of Raptor mini, an experimental model available in GitHub Copilot for Visual Studio Code. The model is being made available to users on Pro, Pro+, and Free plans and can be selected within the Copilot settings. The announcement appeared on the GitHub Blog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: vscode: Open Source AI Editor: Second Milestone
item.description:
Ghost text suggestions have been open sourced as part of the Copilot Chat extension â€” the second milestone toward making VS Code an open source AI editor.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio Code gets upgraded
item.description:
GitHub announced upgrades to Copilot in Visual Studio Code (released to VS Code Insiders) at GitHub Universe 2025, including integration with OpenAI Codex for Copilot Pro+ users.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: vscode: September 2025 (version 1.105)
item.description:
This is the release announcement for Visual Studio Code September 2025 (version 1.105). It directs readers to the full article for details about whatâ€™s new in this release, including feature updates, improvements, fixes, and extension or API changes.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: MSSQL extension integration with Microsoft Fabric
item.description:
The MSSQL extension for Visual Studio Code is available in public preview with built-in connectivity to Microsoft Fabric SQL databases. A new Fabric option in the Connection Dialog lets developers sign in with Microsoft Entra ID and access Fabric resources directly from VS Code, bringing Fabric SQL into the development workflow.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: Auto model selection is now in VS Code for Copilot Business and Enterprise
item.description:
GitHub announced that auto model selection in Visual Studio Code is now available in public preview for Copilot Business and Enterprise plans; the feature automatically selects the appropriate model for you.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Auto model selection for Copilot in VS Code in public preview
item.description:
GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio Code has a new Auto model selection option in public preview that automatically picks the model for you via the model picker.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Enhanced Data Mapper Experience in Logic Apps (Standard)
item.description:
The redesigned Data Mapper user experience in the Azure Logic Apps (Standard) extension for Visual Studio Code is now generally available and becomes the default for creating and editing maps after its public preview.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure SQL updates for late-August 2025
item.description:
Azure SQL and SQL Server received updates in late August 2025, including the general availability of local SQL Server containers via the MSSQL extension for Visual Studio Code.

  • Source: Azure Updates
